title: Comedians kicked out of stand-up show for confronting Harvey Weinstein
text:
Two women in New York were kicked out of a bar after furiously confronting Harvey Weinstein as he sat in the audience at a stand-up show.

Weinstein, 67, who will go on trial in January on charges of rape and sexual assault, was with friends at the Downtime Bar in the Lower East Side of Manhattan.

He has been maintaining a relatively low profile in the city, but on Wednesday night attended a showcase for young actors, entitled Actor's Hour.

He was challenged by one of the performers, with comedian Kelly Bachman saying from the stage: "I'm a comic, and it's our job to confront the elephant in the room. The Freddie Kruger in the room. I didn't know we were expected to bring our own mace and rape whistles to actor's hour."

She was booed, and someone yelled "shut up".

"Oh, 'shut up'?" she said, raising her eyebrows. "This kills at group therapy for rape survivors."

Others cheered, and yelled out their approval.
description: Two women in New York were kicked out of a bar after furiously confronting Harvey Weinstein as he sat in the audience at a stand-up show.
